oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Casper Mansker historic marker, Goodlettsville, Tennessee, 1981 June
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Casper Mansker, Tennessee Historical Marker, located in downtown Goodlettesville that reads: “Casper Mansker, 1746-1820: Two blocks west is the grave of this renowned frontiersman and Goodlettsville’s first citizen. Coming first to the Cumberland Settlements in 1770, he returned in 1780 and built his fort one-half mile north on Mansker’s creek. He repeatedly fought marauding Indians to protect the first white settlers of this region and was made a colonel in the frontier militia. He lived the remainder of his life at his fort which was called Mansker’s Station.” Forms part of the Claynita Harris Slide Collection. The original is a 35 mm color transparency (2 x 2 in. slide mount)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mansker family
